questions.question_text: Which of the following data models are included in the Splunk Common Information Model (CIM) add-on? (Choose all that apply.)

discussion.content:
Alerts
Application State
Authentication
Certificates
Change
Change Analysis
CIM Validation (S.o.S)
Databases
Data Loss Prevention
Email
Endpoint
Event Signatures
Interprocess Messaging
Intrusion Detection
Inventory
Java Virtual Machines (JVM)
Malware
Network Resolution (DNS)
Network Sessions
Network Traffic
Performance
Splunk Audit Logs
Ticket Management
Updates
Vulnerabilities
Web
ABC its correct

Selected Answer: ABC
ABC correct

Selected Answer: ABC
ABC - P273

ABC as per this link:
https://conf.splunk.com/files/2017/slides/the-power-of-data-normalization-a-look-at-cim-under-the-hood.pdf
A,B,C. Slides page 273.

choices.D: Searches generated by workflow actions run with the same permissions as the user running them.
choices.B: Searches generated by workflow actions must be less than 256 characters long.
choices.C: Searches generated by workflow actions must run in the same app as the workflow action.
choices.A: Searches generated by workflow actions cannot use macros.

questions.question_text: What is a limitation of searches generated by workflow actions?

discussion.content: D is the correct answer.

Selected Answer: D
D is the correct answer. It's not C because you can specify a different app to run the search workflow action in: https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/9.1.0/Knowledge/Setupasearchworkflowaction

Yes you can select an app that it runs in but then it must run in the same app as the workflow action. D is incorrect as it mentions the user running them, workflow actions run with the same permissions as the user who triggered the workflow action. Answer is C

Selected Answer: D
p226 fund2
Could you pls confirm the final answer friends?
D is correct
I think C is the correct answer as you have to select destination app when creating the workflow

comments.content: You can specify another app to run with the "Run in app" option for the search workflow

questions.question_text:
Which of the following searches would create a graph similar to the one below?
//IMG//
questions.answer_description: None of these functions related to the graph in exhibit. All of these functions have maxspan=ld which is not a valid argument.

choices.B: index=_internal sourcetype=SavedSplunker | fields sourcetype, status | transaction status maxspan=1d | chart count OVER status by _time
choices.D: None of these searches would generate a similar graph.
choices.A: index=_internal sourcetype=SavedSplunker | fields sourcetype, status | transaction status maxspan=1d | stats count by status
choices.C: index=_internal sourcetype=SavedSplunker | fields sourcetype, status | transaction status maxspan=1d | timechart count by status

discussion.content: Answer is D. The argument maxspan=1d will join events to one transaction by status per day. You would see the curve lines on graph if answer C is right, cause graph values are shown with span=12h

comments.content: The graphs values are well shown with 24h span, it's just the x axis showing the 12h intervals but there is no point in between. C.

Correct, but your reasoning is abit off, maxspan will set the maximum point between the earliest and latest transaction, so 1D would be the maximum limit between the first/last, which is obviously not true in the graph.

discussion.content: C is the right answer.
Should be C, because the question is asking for "similar," not exact, and C is the classiest
C or D

I tested it and C gives similar result. what I tried : 
 index=web sourcetype=access_combined | fields sourcetype, status | transaction status maxspan=1d | timechart count by status

Selected Answer: C
C is the correct answer
what is the correct answ C or D?

comments.content: @Hurshbabe what is the x-axis in your opinion? the vertical or horizontal line? Because i see time on the x-axis.
Timechart must have _time on the x-axis. this is definitely not tirmechart

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C works, tested with different sourcetype that has the same status field with skipped and success
index=_internal sourcetype=scheduler | fields sourcetype, status | transaction status maxspan=1d | timechart count by status

https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/9.0.2/SearchReference/Transaction
maxspan
Syntax: maxspan=<int>[s | m | h | d]
Description: Specifies the maximum length of time in seconds, minutes, hours, or days that the events can span. The events in the transaction must span less than integer specified for maxspan. Events that exceed the maxspan limit are treated as part of a separate transaction. If the value is negative, the maxspan constraint is disabled and there is no limit.
Default: -1 (no limit)
could you pls confirm the final answer friends?
Tested . C appears to be correct

While I was on playing around with the Splunk training data (sourcetype=access_combined_wcookie), seems C produces the same type linechart graph (assuming the status field has only 2 values in the events skipped and success)..
I would go for answer D: (fields sourcetype, status are not equal to skipped and succes)

questions.question_text: What does the transaction command do?

choices.D: Returns the number of credit card transactions found in the event logs.
choices.C: Separates two events based on one or more values.
choices.B: Creates a single event from a group of events.
choices.A: Groups a set of transactions based on time.

discussion.content: correct answer is B

Selected Answer: B
From Splunk training: "The transaction command creates a single event from a group of events."
should be A?

comments.content: It s B, see Fundamentals Part 2 (IOD) PDF page 126

questions.question_text: What is the relationship between data models and pivots?

discussion.content: p.229 F2 pdf
Only right answer is A
Correct ans A

choices.B: Pivots and data models have no relationship.
choices.A: Data models provide the datasets for pivots.
choices.C: Pivots and data models are the same thing.
choices.D: Pivots provide the datasets for data models.
